page.title: 01General Description
page.content: This block is dominated by the ridge of Haldon Hill,developed on fairly resistant Upper Greensand rock.This rock is permeable and produces relatively poor leached soils.As a result,most of the Haldon Hills are given over to afforestation for commercial production.There is a secondary land use of recreation in the form of the Haldon Racetrack, and on the lower slopes pasture is found.Since the mid 1970s part of the Exeter Forest has been opened up for recreation with a number of forest walks and trails being laid out.Facilites include an information hut,leaflets and signposting,together with one main car park and a number of viewpoint car parks.The main A38 and A380 trunk roads pass through the block.
